question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable and demonstrable when possible. Help me create a webpage for "AI Park Innovation" - an AI platform specifically for generating industrial designs, featuring a dedicated information plaza, model integration interface, and generation interface. The page should be simple yet impressive, with the words "AI Park Innovation" appearing on each page.

checklist.title: Is the main webpage structure properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the HTML structure follows semantic principles with proper sectioning (header, main, footer), responsive layout, and correct navigation between the three key sections (information plaza, model integration interface, and generation interface). Check if the title 'AI Park Innovation' appears consistently on each page. Score 0 if basic structure is missing, 5 if structure exists but with improper hierarchy, and 10 if perfectly structured with proper semantic HTML5 tags and responsive design principles.

checklist.title: Is the information plaza functionality complete?
checklist.description: Review whether the information plaza includes essential components like news feed, featured designs, user highlights, and information filtering/searching. Check if dynamic content loading is implemented, if pagination or infinite scrolling works, and if the content display adapts to different screen sizes. Deduct 3 points if filtering is missing, 4 points if dynamic loading isn't implemented, and 3 points if responsiveness fails on mobile devices. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the model integration interface functional and intuitive?
checklist.description: Assess the model integration interface for its ability to upload/select AI models, configure parameters, and display integration status. Verify if the interface includes model compatibility checking, parameter validation, and visual feedback during integration processes. Deduct 5 points if there's no error handling for model uploads, 3 points if parameter configuration is confusing, and 2 points if visual feedback during processes is missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the AI design generation interface well-implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate the design generation interface for input mechanisms (text prompts, reference images, parameter settings), generation state management, and result visualization. Check if it includes progress indicators, cancellation options, and history tracking. Deduct 4 points if there's no visual preview or progress indication, 3 points if the interface lacks parameter fine-tuning, and 3 points if history/saved designs aren't accessible. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid inputs, network failures, image loading errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time AI design preview 2. Collaborative design capabilities 3. AR visualization of generated designs). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple image uploaders) 2. Function modules unrelated to industrial design generation (e.g., social networking functions) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow down core functionality). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating UI/API/state management), component reusability, and build process optimization. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or modern frontend frameworks aren't leveraged; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build/bundling process is inefficient. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during transitions, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
